title: Family Separation Policy ('Zero Tolerance')
summary: 'Zero tolerance' policy (April 2018) resulted in systematic separation of thousands of children from parents at border. Children held in detention facilities described as 'cages.' Over 5,400 children separated; hundreds still not reunited years later. Drew bipartisan criticism. Trump ended policy via Executive Order after intense public outcry (June 20, 2018).
keyFacts: 'Zero tolerance' policy (April 2018) resulted in systematic separation of thousands of children from parents at border
Children held in detention facilities, some in what critics described as 'cages'
Hundreds still not reunited years later
Trump ended policy via Executive Order 13841 after intense public outcry (June 20, 2018)
Policy was active for approximately 2 months before being reversed

sources.text: DHS Inspector General reports, ACLU tracking, 2018-2024
